abstract.text: Retrieves source audio for an audio processing tap.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The processing tap.
The number of frames the processing tap requires for its processing.
The audio buffer list which will contain the source data.
On input, all fields except for the buffer pointers must be filled in.
If the buffer pointers are NULL (recommended), non-NULL pointers will be
returned and system owns the source buffers; these buffers are only applicable
for the duration of the processing tap callback.
If the buffer pointers are non-NULL, then they must be big enough to hold
numberFrames, and the source data will be copied into these buffers.
Flags to describe state about the input requested, e.g., discontinuity/complete. Can be NULL.
The asset time range corresponding to the provided source audio frames. Can be NULL.
The number of source frames that have been provided. Can be NULL. This can be less than the number of requested frames specified in numberFrames.
An
result code.
This function may only be called from the processing tap’s callback.

abstract.text: Enable support for media format readers; tap and process audio from an audio mix.
Creates a new audio processing tap.
Flags that indicate where to tap the audio.
Retrieves source audio for an audio processing tap.
Retrieves a custom storage pointer for an audio processing tap.
Retrieves the type identifier for this audio processing tap.
A structure that stores a variable-length array of audio buffers.
A structure that represents a time range.
A datatype that represents an item count.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.

The number of source frames that have been provided. Can be NULL. This can be less than the number of requested frames specified in numberFrames.
An
result code.
